info.name: Reply API Documentation
info.description:
Welcome to the Reply.io API guide. Let's get you integrated smoothly!

# API Endpoint

Our platform utilizes the endpoint: `api.reply.io` We offer two versions of our API: `V1` and `V2`, each with its unique functionalities. You're free to employ both versions in tandem if desired.

# Authentication

To gain access to the API:

1. Login into your Reply Account
    
2. Navigate to `Settings`
    
3. Find and copy your API key under `API Key`.
    

ðŸ”‘ **API Key Example:** `AKp2BbuyfS-ugPMkBmd3sg2`

# Constructing API Requests:

All your requests will start with either:

- `https://api.reply.io/v1/` or
    
- `https://api.reply.io/v2/`
    

# Response Codes

- 200 - All good! Request was successful.
    
- 201 - Success! A new item was created.
    
- 400 - Uh-oh! There's an issue with your input parameter. Check the response for more information.
    
- 401 - User not found. This means no users match the API key provided.
    
- 403 - Access denied. The API key you've provided doesn't have the required permissions for the resource you're trying to access.
    
- 404 - Resource not found. Double-check your URL or the resource identifier. More details can be found in the response.
    
- 500 - Our bad! There's an internal server error. We've been notified and will get on it ASAP. Check the response for any extra information
    

# Rate Limits

To ensure optimal performance and equitable usage for all users, the Reply API has set rate limits:

- **Monthly API Calls**: Each Reply user is allowed up to 15,000 API calls every month.
    
- **API Throttling**: There is no general throttling, but certain requests may be subject to throttling, refer to the specific request in this guide for more details.
    

Please ensure to stay within these limits to avoid any disruptions in service.

request.description:
# Description: This endpoint returns basic campaign details and stats by campaign name # Notes: 1. When specifying the `name` value, it's crucial to encode it to avoid issues with spaces or other special characters within the campaign name. For instance: `Campaign One` should be passed as `...?name=Campaign+One` # Throttling: - There is a 10-second throttle between requests. # Response Body Data: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `id` | integer | Represents the campaign ID. | | `name` | string | Denotes the campaign's name. | | `created` | datetime | Indicates the date and time the campaign was created. | | `status` | integer | Campaign Current Status:
0 = New
2 = Active
4 = Paused | | `emailAccounts` | array | Specifies one or more email accounts that will be used to send emails for this campaign. | | `ownerEmail` | string | Represents the email of the campaign's owner. | | `deliveriesCount` | integer | Total number of emails sent in the campaign. | | `opensCount` | integer | Number of emails that were opened. | | `repliesCount` | integer | Counts the number of email replies received. | | `bouncesCount` | integer | Number of email bounces. | | `optOutsCount` | integer | Number of opt-outs. | | `outOfOfficeCount` | integer | Number of out-of-office replies. | | `peopleCount` | integer | Total number of contacts in the campaign. | | `peopleFinished` | integer | Number of contacts who have finished the campaign's cycle. | | `peopleActive` | integer | Contacts currently active in the campaign. | | `peoplePaused` | integer | Number of contacts paused in the campaign. |

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint returns a list of all schedules (both default and user-created) associated with a user's account.

# Notes:

1. **Team Edition Consideration**: If the Team Edition is activated (either Public or Private mode), this endpoint will return schedules from all team accounts, not just the individual user's account.
2. **Default Schedules Specificity**: Default schedules are personalized and linked directly to individual user accounts. Consequently, invoking this request using API keys from different team members might yield varying results.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | number | Unique identifier for the record. |
| name | string | Name associated with the record. |
| timezoneId | atring | ID representing the timezone. |
| mainTimings | array | List of timings for the main schedule. |
| weekDay | string | Name of the day in the week (e.g., "Sunday"). |
| isActive | boolean | Indicates if the timing is active on that day. |
| timeRanges | array | List of time range objects representing start and end times. |
| fromTime | object | Object representing the start time of the time range. |
| hour | number | Hour component of the time (0-23). |
| minute | number | Minute component of the time (0-59). |
| toTime | object | Object representing the end time of the time range. |
| hour | number | Hour component of the time (0-23). |
| minute | number | Minute component of the time (0-59). |
| followUpTimings | array | List of timings for the follow-up schedule. |
| isDefault | boolean | Indicates if the record is the default one. |

response.name: Get List of Campaign Schedule (All)

# Description:

This endpoint retrieves the default schedule associated with the user's account.

# Note:

1. **Team Edition Consideration**: Even if the Team Edition is activated (either in Public or Private mode), this endpoint will only return one default schedule. This is because the default schedule is uniquely tied to the individual user's account, regardless of team settings.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | number | Unique identifier for the record. |
| name | string | Name associated with the record. |
| timezoneId | string | ID representing the timezone. |
| mainTimings | array | List of timings for the main schedule. |
| weekDay | string | Name of the day in the week (e.g., "Sunday"). |
| isActive | boolean | Indicates if the timing is active on that day. |
| timeRanges | array | List of time range objects representing start and end times. |
| fromTime | object | Object representing the start time of the time range. |
| hour | number | Hour component of the time (0-23). |
| minute | number | Minute component of the time (0-59). |
| toTime | object | Object representing the end time of the time range. |
| hour | number | Hour component of the time (0-23). |
| minute | number | Minute component of the time (0-59). |
| followUpTimings | array | List of timings for the follow-up schedule. |
| isDefault | boolean | Indicates if the record is the default one. |

# Description:

Returns a list of all contacts in your Reply account.

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| people | array | An array containing all the people (contacts) from the Reply account. |
| total | integer | Total number of people (contacts) in the account. |
| page | integer | Indicates the current page number. |
| limit | integer | The number of contacts shown per page. Default value is 100. |
| pagesCount | integer | Total number of pages based on the current `limit`. |
| next | string | URL link for the next page based on the current `limit`. |
| previous | string | URL link for the previous page based on the current `limit`. |

request.description:
# Description:

Returns the campaign(s) a contact belongs to.

# Note:

The "Sequence Owner" flag's result is determined by the API key provided in the endpoint request. If the API key and the sequence belong to the same user, the "Sequence Owner" flag will be set to `true`. If they do not belong to the same user, it will return as `false`.

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| sequenceId | integer | ID of the sequence. |
| sequenceName | string | Name of the sequence. |
| status | string | The current status of the sequence. |
| isSequenceOwner | boolean | Indicates if the sequence belongs to the current user. |

response.name: Get List of Campaigns for Contact

item.name: Get List of Contacts with stage changes

header.description: Your API Key from settings

query.description:
The ID of the team to filter. This can be found in the â€œteamsâ€ query in your browser's dev tool. The display of the response in this endpoint depends on the role of the user in the Organization:
1. The Owner of the Organization can see prospects with changed stages in any team.
2. The Lead of a team that is part of the Organization can see prospects only in the teams to which he belongs and where he has the status of Lead. In other cases - 403 error.
3. Members who are part of the Organization - do not see any prospects, only a 403 error.

The date of the earliest stage change. The preferred format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss (AM/PM). For example 2023-11-16 00:00:00 (and AM/PM if 12-hour clock). The time is optional. When not specified, it's defaulted to 00:00:00 (AM, midnight).

The date of the latest stage change. The preferred format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss (AM/PM). For example 2023-11-16 00:00:00 (and AM/PM if 12-hour clock). The time is optional. When not specified, it's defaulted to 00:00:00 (AM, midnight)

request.description:
# Description: **This endpoint returns contacts that had their stage changed over the specified date range (date range should not exceed 3 days).** **If a stage was eventually changed to itself (for example, Replied -> Interested -> Replied), such a prospect wouldn't be present in the results.** # Note: **This endpoint returns only contacts that belong to any sequence. So, place the prospect you want to analyze into any sequence to get data on its stage change.** # Throttling: - There is no throttling for this endpoint # Response Body Data: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | people | array | An array containing all people (contacts) from the Reply account that match search criteria | | stageId | integer | The ID of the contact's stage:

Possible default values:
1 = New
2 = Engaging
3 = Replied
4 = Interested
5 = Not interested
6 = Unresponsive
7 = Do not contact
8 = Bad contact info

Default value names can be customized in the user settings. In such cases, the ID will remain the same, but the name will change. | | stageName | string | The name of the contac's stage | | stageChangedAtUTC | string | Date and time when the contact's stage was set (in UTC format) | | ownerId | integer | The ID of the ReplyUser to which Contac's belong. | | ownerName | string | The Name of the ReplyUser to which Contac's belong. | | teamId | integer | The ID of the ReplyUser team in which Contac's is present. | | teamName | string | The Name of the ReplyUser team in which Contac's is present. | | id | integer | The ID of the contact. | | email | string | The email address of the contact. | | firstName | string | The first name of the contact. | | lastName | string | The last name of the contact. | | company | string | The company the contact is associated with. | | city | string | The city where the contact resides | | state | string | The state where the contact resides. | | country | string | The country where the contact resides. | | timeZoneId | boolean | ID representing the contact's time zone (e.g., "US Eastern Standard Time"). | | title | boolean | The contact's job title. | | phone | boolean | Contact's phone number. | | phoneStatus | integer | Validation Status of the Contact's Phone Number, where
Pending = 0,
Invalid = 1,
Valid = 2,
ValidationFailed = 3,
NotValidated = 4 | | linkedInProfile | boolean | Link to the contact's LinkedIn profile. | | addingDate | datetime | The date and time when the contact was added to the system. | | customFields | array | List of custom fields associated with the contact. | | companySize | string | Information about the number of employees within Contact's company. | | industry | string | Information about the specific sector or category of business in which Contact's company operates | | salesNavigatorUrl | boolean | Link to the contact's Sales Navigator profile. | | linkedInRecruiterUrl | boolean | Link to the contact's LinkedIn Recruiter profile. | | accountId | boolean | The ID of the Accout to which Contact's belongs. |

response.name: Get List of Contacts with stage changes

request.description:
# Description:

Returns a list of all contacts associated with a specific List ID from the People page in your Reply account.

# Note:

The `people` array will contain detailed contact objects, each representing an individual contact associated with the specified List ID.

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| people | array | An array of individual contact objects. |
| total | integer | The total count of people. |
| page | integer | The current page number. |
| limit | integer | The maximum number of contacts returned on a single page. Default value is `100`. |
| pagesCount | integer | The total number of pages, given the current `limit`. |
| next | string | The URL for the next page, based on the current `limit`. |
| previous | string | The URL for the previous page, based on the current `limit`. |

request.description:
# Description:

Returns a list of all contacts associated with a specific List Name from the People page in your Reply account.

# Note:

The `people` array will contain detailed contact objects, each representing an individual contact associated with the specified List Name.

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| people | array | An array of individual contact objects. |
| total | integer | The total count of people. |
| page | integer | The current page number. |
| limit | integer | The maximum number of contacts returned on a single page. Default value is `100`. |
| pagesCount | integer | The total number of pages, given the current `limit`. |
| next | string | The URL for the next page, based on the current `limit`. |
| previous | string | The URL for the previous page, based on the current `limit`. |

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint allows you to add contacts or update them if they already exist.

# Note:

- You can include other standard and custom fields in the POST request when creating a contact.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Request Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| email | string | Email address of the contact. | Yes |
| firstName | string | First name of the contact. | Yes |
| lastName | string | Last name of the contact. | No |
| company | string | Name of the contact's company or organization. | No |
| city | string | City where the contact is located. (May be empty in this example) | No |
| state | string | State where the contact is located. (May be empty in this example) | No |
| country | string | Country where the contact is located (e.g., "USA"). | No |
| timeZoneId | string | ID representing the contact's time zone (e.g., "US Eastern Standard Time"). | No |
| title | string | Contact's job title or position. | No |
| phone | string | Contact's phone number. | No |
| linkedInProfile | string | Link to the contact's LinkedIn profile. | No |
| customFields | array | List of custom fields associated with the contact. | No |
| key | string | Key or name of the custom field. | No |
| value | string | Value associated with the custom field. | No |

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | integer | The ID of the contact. |
| email | string | The email address of the contact. |
| firstName | string | The first name of the contact. |
| lastName | string | The last name of the contact. |
| company | string | The company the contact is associated with. |
| city | string | The city where the contact resides. |
| state | string | The state where the contact resides. |
| country | string | The country where the contact resides. |
| title | string | The contact's job title. |
| notes | string | Any notes associated with the contact. |
| addingDate | datetime | The date and time when the contact was added to the system. |

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint allows you to force-push an existing contact to a selected campaign based on `forcePush` parameter specified in request body

# Notes:

1. If the `forcePush` parameter is set to `true`, and the contact is already present in a campaign, they will be moved from their current campaign to the new one.
2. If the `forcePush` parameter is set to `false`, the contact will remain in their current campaign and won't be pushed to the new one.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Request Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| campaignId | integer | The ID of the campaign to which to push the contact. | Required |
| email | string | The email address of the contact. | Required |
| forcePush | boolean | A boolean value indicating whether to force-push the contact. | Required |

# Response Body Data:

- No additional responce data is returned

header.description: Your API Key from settings

query.description: Email of your specified contact you own

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint allows you to retrieve detailed statistics for a contact based on their email address.

# Note:

1. To ensure security in the GET request, the '@' character in the email address should be escaped as '%' and '40' (e.g demo%40reply.io)
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | number | Identifier for the contact. |
| email | string | Email address of the contact. |
| fullName | string | Full name of the contact. |
| isBlocked | boolean | Indicates whether the contact is blocked (true/false). |
| isOptedOut | boolean | Indicates whether the contact has opted out (true/false). |
| campaigns | array | List of campaigns associated with the contact. |
| id | number | Identifier for the campaign. |
| name | string | Name of the campaign. |
| status | string | Status of the campaign (e.g., "Paused"). |
| personStatus | string | Status of the person within the campaign (e.g., "Finished"). |
| replyDate | number | Timestamp for the reply date. |
| replyText | string | Text of the reply message. |
| inboxState | string | State of the inbox (e.g., "Interested"). |
| emails | array | List of emails associated with the campaign. |
| stepNum | number | Step number for the email. |
| date | number | Timestamp for the email date. |
| opened | boolean | Indicates whether the email was opened (true/false). |
| bounced | boolean | Indicates whether the email bounced (true/false). |
| replied | boolean | Indicates whether a reply was received for the email (true/false). |

response.name: Get Contact Statistics

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Request-Context
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint allows you to retrieve detailed statistics for a contact, specifically for contacts within Team Edition that you have access to.

# Note:

1. The Contact or Sequence Owner flag result is based on the inserted API key per endpoint.
2. When the API key and Contact or Sequence belong to the same user, the Contact or Sequence Owner flag will be `true`.
3. Otherwise, it will return as `false`. Contact and Sequence Owner flags are available only when Team Edition is enabled.
4. If you do not have access to the contact with the specified email, the system will return a 404 error.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | integer | The ID of the contact. |
| email | string | The email address of the contact. |
| fullName | string | The full name of the contact. |
| isBlocked | boolean | Whether the contact is blacklisted. |
| isOptedOut | boolean | Whether the contact has opted out. |
| isContactOwner | boolean | Whether the contact belongs to the current user. |
| campaigns | array | Information about campaigns the contact is participating in. |
| campaignsIsSequenceOwner | boolean | Whether the campaign belongs to the current user. |
| emails | array | Information about emails within the given campaign. |

query.description: Id of your specified campaign step
Your starting date in UTC timestamp format
Your finish date in UTC timestamp format

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint provides comprehensive statistics for a specific campaign step, including the number of contacts contacted, emails sent, open rates, reply rates, and more. You can use the `from` and `to` parameters to specify the time interval for the statistics you want to retrieve.

# Notes:

1. The statistics are displayed in real-time for the current campaign step, and making subsequent API requests will return updated statistics.
    
2. Removing a contact from a campaign does not change step statistics, but adding or deleting contacts from Reply can change step statistics if the added contact has sent emails from the campaign, and so on.
    
3. If the specified step is deleted, the response will return a 400 code.
    
4. If the specified campaign is deleted, the response will return a 400 code.
    
5. If the specified campaign is archived, the response will return a 400 code.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| campaignId | integer | The ID of the specified campaign. |
| campaignName | string | The name of the campaign. |
| deliveredProspectsCount | integer | The number of contacts who received at least one email in the campaign. |
| stepId | integer | The ID of the specified step in the campaign. |
| stepNumber | integer | The number of the step in the campaign. |
| contactedPeople | integer | The number of people contacted on the step. |
| peopleSentTo | integer | The number of people the email was sent to on the current step. |
| openedPeople | integer | The number of people who opened the email on the current step. |
| repliedPeople | integer | The number of replied contacts on the current step. |
| bouncedPeople | integer | The number of bounced contacts on the current step. |
| clickedPeople | integer | The number of contacts that opened a link. |
| deliveryRate | integer | The step's delivery rate. |
| openRate | integer | The step's open rate. |
| replyRate | integer | The step's reply rate. |
| interestedRate | integer | The step's interested rate. |
| sentEmails | integer | The number of emails sent on the current step. |
| openedEmails | integer | The number of emails opened on the current step. |
| repliedEmails | integer | The number of emails with replies detected on the current step. |
| bouncedEmails | integer | The number of emails with bounces detected on the current step. |
| clickedEmails | integer | The number of links opened on the current step. |

header.description: Your API Key from settings

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint allows you to retrieve the number of clicks in a specific campaign, along with detailed information about the clicks for each step of the campaign. It provides insight into the number of clicks and individual email link clicks within each campaign step.

# Notes:

1. If `campaignId` is not provided, the response will return a 400 code.
2. If the specified campaign is not found, the response will return a 404 code.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Responce Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| campaignId | number | Identifier for the campaign. |
| stepClicks | array | List of steps and their associated click data. |
| stepId | number | Identifier for the step. |
| links | array | List of links clicked within the step. |
| textToDisplay | string | Text displayed for the link. |
| title | string | Title of the link (if available). |
| url | string | URL of the link. |
| clicks | number | Number of times the link was clicked. |
| lastClickDate | string | Timestamp for the last click date on the link. |

request.description:
# Description:

This endpoint allows you to create a new email account within your Reply settings.

# Notes:

- You can only add email accounts by using the "other provider" setup.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint.
    

# Request Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Email | string | The email address used for sending emails. | Yes |
| Daily Limit | integer | The maximum number of emails you can send per day | Yes |
| SenderName | string | The name that will be displayed as the sender in email recipients' inboxes | Yes |
| SmtpHost | string | The hostname or IP address of the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server used for sending emails. | Yes |
| SmtpPort | integer | The port number used for communication with the SMTP server (typically 465 for SMTP with SSL/TLS encryption). | Yes |
| SmtpPassword | string | The password for the email address used for sending emails | Yes |
| SmtpSsl | boolean | This option controls whether SSL is used for the SMTP connection | No |
| ImapHost | string | The hostname or IP address of the Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) server used for receiving emails. | Yes |
| ImapPort | integer | The port number used for communication with the IMAP server (typically 993 for IMAP with SSL/TLS encryption). | Yes |
| ImapPassword | string | The password for the email address used for receiving emails | Yes |
| ImapSsl | boolean | This option controls whether SSL is used for the IMAP connection | No |

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | integer | Created Email account ID. |

item.description:
# Description: Reply webhooks provide a seamless way to receive notifications about events within the Reply platform. With webhooks, you can set up your server to be alerted whenever specific events occur. These webhooks are triggered whenever one or more of the subscribed events take place. When Reply's events are triggered, we send an HTTP POST payload to the URL you've configured for your webhook subscription. These payloads are delivered in JSON format and contain both common fields and event-specific data. # Webhook Types: Reply supports several webhook types, each corresponding to a specific event: - **email_replied**: Triggered when a prospect replies to an email or when a prospect's status is set to 'Replied.' - **reply_categorized**: Triggered when a reply is categorized with a new inbox category. If an uncategorized category is assigned, the webhook will not be triggered. - **email_sent**: Triggered when a new email is sent, either as the first step or as a follow-up. - **email_opened**: Triggered when a person opens your email. - **contact_opted_out**: Triggered when a person opts out of further communication. - **contact_finished**: Triggered when a prospect finishes a sequence with various finish reasons. - **contact_called**: Triggered when a cloud call is made or logged with call details. - **email_link_clicked**: Triggered when a user clicks on a link within an email sent as part of a sequence. # Rate Limits: We are currently limiting the number of webhooks to 30 per user regardless of the webhook type. # Retry policy: The webhook didn't pass if any HTTP status except 200-299 is returned. We retry webhooks with 429, 500, 502 HTTP statuses and whenever a timeout occurs. If webhook retries are unsuccessful, the event is considered as failed. # Disabling webhooks: To avoid performance issues, when Reply tries to call an unresponsive URL, we suggest to turn off webhooks. The webhook is disabled when after the first failed attempt: - not a single event passed during 48 hours, and if - the consecutive number of 5 webhook calls failed (if more than 48 hours are needed to have 5 webhook calls) An event is considered failed if 100% of its retries are failed. # Webhook payload Webhooks deliver responses in JSON format. Each webhook payload consists of a common part and some fields specific to the webhook. # Common webhook fields: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | contact fields | object | Set of fields to describe a contact | | id | integer | Contact's ID | | email | string | Contact's email | | domain | string | Contact's domain | | first name | string | Contact's first name | | last name | string | Contact's last name | | full name | string | Contact's full name | | title | string | Contact's title | | company | string | Contact's company | | phone | string | Contact's phone | | city | string | Contact's city | | state | string | Contact's state | | country | string | Contact's country | | time zone id | string | Contact's current time zone | | linkedin profile url | string | Contact's LinkedIn URL | | company size | integer | Contact's current company size | | industry | string | Contact's current company industry | | linkedin sales navigator | string | Contact's Sales Navigator URL | | linkedin recruiter | string | Contact's LinkedIn Recruiter URL | | sequence fields | object | Set of fields to describe the sequence | | id | integer | Sequence ID | | step number | integer | Number of the step in the sequence | | contact custom fields | object | Custom fields for the contact | | name: value | string | Pair of custom name and value for the contact | | event | object | Set of fields for the event | | date | datetime | Sequence creation date in UTC | | id | guid | Event connected with the webhook ID | # Email_Replied webhook specific fields: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | reply_message_id | integer | ID of the reply message | | reply_date | DateTime | Date of the reply in UTC | | sent_email_id | integer | ID of the sent message to which the reply was received | | email_account_id | integer | Account ID of the sender | | reply_message_url | string | URL for downloading the message in eml format | | reason | integer | How the replied status was obtained. Next options are available:
1 = Set status from email
2 = Manual change of status (either from API or manually in UI) | # Example: ``` json {"event":{"date":"2021-05-12T11:31:07.3988011Z","id":"0924f030-b1c8-45dd-b4f1-014f98e1d6ad"}, "email_account_id":2568, "sent_email_id":1779412, "reply_date":"0001-01-01T00:00:00", "reply_message_id":"CALTTm5mJxhxNQsFq0UEmi6znh0k6o8opJ_RdEEj1Je9Ptk3vUw@mail.gmail.com", "reason": 1, "contact_fields":{ "id":11642366, "email":"olivia@reply.io", "first_name":"Olivia", "last_name":"Milton", "full_name":"Olivia Milton", "title":"CMO", "company":"Reply", "linkedin_profile_url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/olivia-milton-39385155/", "city":"West Andre", "state":"JE", "country":"California", "time_zone_id":"Greenwich Standard Time", "phone":"380986821706", "domain":"croate.space", "company_size":"Empty", "industry":"", "linkedin_sales_navigator":null, "linkedin_recruiter":null}, "contact_custom_fields":{ "CustomCRM_Percentage": "25", "CustomCRM_TextArea": "" }, "reply_url":"https://replyappstages.blob.core.windows.net/emails/6c2a7c7f0fe3483da4cdf1db575cc472?sv=2019-02-02&sr=b&sig=oHeWC3ZmAI5e3t8d3y9SMVZQA6f/W8f62jftTxrRSpk=&se=2021-05-19T11:31:07Z&sp=r", "sequence_fields":{ "id":122140, "step_number":0} } ``` # Email_Sent webhook specific fields: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | sent_email_date | DateTime | Date and time when the email was sent in UTC | | sent_email_id | integer | ID of the sent email | | _sent_email_message_id_ | string | Email sent message identifier (string format) | | sent_email_variant | string | Letter of the email variant | | email_account_id | integer | ID of the email account from which the email was sent | | email_from | string | Email address from which the email was sent | | sent_message_url | string | (Optional) URL for downloading the message in eml format | # Example: ``` json { "event": { "date": "2021-05-12T13:18:15.1908441Z", "id": "319dcca5-3765-42f2-9d91-d56aab875a3e" }, "sent_email_id": 1779553, "sent_email_message_id": "UMH5HKKNPDU4.ADQJEWESBPYL2@RD0003FF2328E2", "sent_email_date": "2021-05-12T13:18:11.41", "email_account_id": 3794, "contact_fields": { "id": 11416895, "email": "olivia@reply.io", "first_name": "Olivia", "last_name": "Milton", "full_name": "Olivia Milton", "title": "CMO", "company": "Reply", "linkedin_profile_url": "https://www.linkedin.com/in/olivia-milton-39385155/", "city": "Kopujku", "state": "ID", "country": "United States", "time_zone_id": "UTC-11", "phone": "+17182444444", "domain": "reply.io", "company_size": "51-200", "industry": "Industry", "linkedin_sales_navigator": null, "linkedin_recruiter": "www.xxxx.com" }, "contact_custom_fields": { "CustomCRM_Percentage": "25", "CustomCRM_TextArea": "" }, "reply_url": "https://replyappstages.blob.core.windows.net/emails/57d83be983a54bfb8accc3ed520e00dc?sv=2019-02-02&sr=b&sig=yDPss9rkQbvaZA6iXlgjkdIT8Sk1kc8QE6H6an82UKE=&se=2021-05-19T13:18:15Z&sp=r", "sequence_fields": { "id": 122145, "step_number": 1 } } ``` # Email_Opened webhook specific fields: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | email_open_date | DateTime | Date and time when the email was opened in UTC | | sent_email_id | integer | ID of the sent email | | sent_email_message_id | string | Email sent message identifier | | email_account_id | integer | ID of the account from which the email was sent | | opens_count | integer | Number of times the email was opened | # Example: ``` json { "event": { "date": "2021-05-12T11:56:49.6577408Z", "id": "4fd24e14-e51d-43e7-a9de-ff45131e604c" }, "email_account_id": 3794, "opens_count": 1, "email_open_date": "2021-05-12T11:56:49.242521Z", "sent_email_id": 1779286, "sent_email_message_id": "OTZ0MJNLPDU4.WATNWQB0E14O3@RD0003FF2328E2", "contact_fields": { "id": 11642421, "email": "olivia@reply.io", "first_name": "Olivia", "last_name": "Milton", "full_name": "Olivia Milton", "title": "CMO", "company": "Reply", "linkedin_profile_url": null, "city": "St. Petersburg", "state": "Florida", "country": "India", "time_zone_id": null, "phone": "40410", "domain": "reply.io", "company_size": "Empty", "industry": "", "linkedin_sales_navigator": null, "linkedin_recruiter": null }, "contact_custom_fields": { "CustomCRM_Percentage": "25", "CustomCRM_TextArea": "" }, "sequence_fields": { "id": 122145 } } ``` # Contact_Opted_Out\` webhook specific fields: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | opt_out_date | DateTime | Date and time when the customer opted out in UTC | # Example: ``` json { "event": { "date": "2021-05-12T12:20:20.8460204Z", "id": "45f80168-09c5-48d8-9410-5e8932aaf689" }, "ProspectOptOutDate": "2021-05-12T12:20:20.5366252Z", "contact_fields": { "id": 11238664, "email": "olivia@reply.io", "first_name": "Olivia", "last_name": "Milton", "full_name": "Olivia Milton", "title": "CMO", "company": "Reply", "linkedin_profile_url": "", "city": "Jacksonville", "state": "Florida", "country": "Serbia", "time_zone_id": null, "phone": "381112094444", "domain": "reply.io", "company_size": "Empty", "industry": "", "linkedin_sales_navigator": null, "linkedin_recruiter": null }, "contact_custom_fields": { "CustomCRM_Percentage": "25", "CustomCRM_TextArea": "" }, "sequence_fields": { "id": 122145 } } ``` # Contact_Finished webhook specific fields: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | finished_date | DateTime | Date and time when the contact finished in UTC | | finish_reason | integer | Finish reason options:
0 = Replied
1 = Bounced
2 = Manual
3 = Finished after number of days (sequence settings)
5 = Called
6 = Opt-out
7 = Meeting booked | # Example: ``` json { "event": { "date": "2021-05-12T12:03:40.5395757Z", "id": "e48fd218-51e8-4def-8804-860e770559dd" }, "finished_date": "2021-05-12T12:03:40.4728229Z", "finish_reason": 2, "contact_fields": { "id": 11642481, "email": "olivia@reply.io", "first_name": "Olivia", "last_name": "Milton", "full_name": "Olivia Milton", "title": "CMO", "company": "Reply", "linkedin_profile_url": "https://www.linkedin.com/in/olivia-milton-39385155/", "city": "Toronto", "state": "Ontario", "country": "Canada", "time_zone_id": "Eastern Standard Time", "phone": "+380505555555", "domain": "reply.io", "company_size": "51-200", "industry": "IT", "linkedin_sales_navigator": null, "linkedin_recruiter": "https://www.linkedin.com/recruiter/profile/478023905,1Jli,CAP" }, "contact_custom_fields": { "SF_Text": "Custom_Text123", "SF_Number": "123", "CustomCRM_CheckBox": "", "CustomCRM_Curency": "", "CustomCRM_Date": "", "CustomCRM_DropDown": "", "CustomCRM_MultiDropDown": "", "CustomCRM_Percentage": "25", "CustomCRM_TextArea": "", "CustomCRM_Url": "" }, "sequence_fields": { "id": 122147 } } ``` # Contact_Called webhook specific fields: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | from_number | string | The phone number used as the "from" number | | duration | integer | The duration of the call in milliseconds | | recording_url | string | URL with the recording of the call | | notes | string | Details or notes of the call | | disposition | string | Disposition of the call with options:
\- Answered
\- Logged Manually
\- Busy
\- Failed
\- No answer | | resolution | string | Resolution of the call with options:
\- Positive

This endpoint provides the URL for accessing a report that is in the process of being generated.

# Notes:

- Returns a 202 code upon success.
    
- The 'LOCATION' response header will contain the URL for accessing the report. To access the report, you need to execute another GET request with the copied 'LOCATION' header as request route and the added "X-Api-Key" request header. [Check here for an example](https://apidocs.reply.io/#d3b56f76-3f1c-4250-9457-326f24f5f84e)
    

# Responce Data:

- No additional responce data is returned

request.description:
# Description: This endpoint returns your generated report in plain text for further usage. # Notes: - Returns a 200 code upon success. - If a user accesses the download link before the report is ready, a 404 code will be returned. - If a user accesses the download link without their ApiKey, a 401 code will be returned. # Response Body Data: - Response data is returned as plain text with the following data: | Field | Description | | --- | --- | | Sequence name | The name of the campaign. | | Sequence Id | The ID of the specified campaign. | | Owner email | Represents the email of the campaign's owner. | | Email account | Specifies one or more email accounts that are used to send emails from this campaign. | | Sequence status | Campaign Current Status:
New
Active
Paused | | Prospects count | The number of prospects to whom emails have been sent. | | Active count | The number of prospects that are currently in sequence AND have received emails AND have status 'Active'. | | Bounced count | The number of prospects emails sent to whom have been rejected (most probably prospect's email address is not valid). | | Bounce rate % | The bounce percentage rate, which is calculated using the following formula:
Bounced count / Prospects count \* 100. | | Clicked count | The number of prospects that clicked at least one link in at least one email. | | Click through rate | The clicked percentage rate, which is calculated using the following formula:
Clicks count \* 100/Contacted | | Contacted count | The number of prospects emails sent to whom have not bounced AND prospects are neither in status 'Out of Office' nor 'Auto replied'. | | Delivered count | The number of prospects emails sent to whom have not bounced. | | Interested count | The number of prospects that were categorized or marked as 'Interested' after emails were sent to them. | | interestedRate | The interested percentage rate, which is calculated using the following formula:
Interested count / Contacted count \* 100 | | NotInterested count | The number of prospects that were categorized or marked as 'Not Interested' after emails were sent to them. | | NotNow count | The number of prospects that were categorized or marked as 'Not Now' after emails were sent to them. | | DoNotContact count | The number of prospects that were categorized or marked as 'Do not Contact' after emails were sent to them. | | Opened count | The number of prospects who opened email(s) at least once. | | Open rate % | The opened percentage rate, which is calculated using the following formula:
Opened count / Contacted count \* 100 | | Paused count | The number of prospects that are currently in sequence AND have received emails AND have status 'Paused'. | | Opened count | The number of prospects who opened email(s) at least once. | | Replied count | The number of prospects emails sent to whom have not been bounced and prospects are neither in status 'Out of Office' nor 'Auto replied' AND we received an email reply from them. | | Reply rate % | The reply percentage rate, which is calculated using the following formula:
Replied count / Contacted count \* 100 | | AutoReplied count | The number of prospects to whom emails have been sent AND they currently have 'Auto replied' status. | | OutOfOffice count | The number of prospects to whom emails have been sent AND they currently have 'Out of office' status. | | OptedOut count | The number of prospects to whom emails have been sent AND they have opted out from receiving emails (expressed desire to stop receiving such emails). | | Start date | The creation date of current Campaign. |

response.name: Get Generated Email Report

query.description:
Filters contacts by the most recent status received at the end of the date range.

Possible values:
Active = 1
Paused = 2
Finished = 3
Inactive = 4
OutOfOffice = 5
Replied = 6
Bounced = 7
AutoReplied = 8
OptedOut = 9
Clicked = 10
Opened = 11
Contacted = 12
Called = 13
ToCall = 14
MeetingBooked = 15

Id of the user to filter by.
The filtered user should be in the same organization as the API user if they are a member of one, or in the same team otherwise.
If unspecified, the result is filtered by the organization of the API user if they are a member of one, or by the team otherwise.

The date of the earliest status change.
The preferred format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss (AM/PM). For example 2023-11-16 00:00:00 (and AM/PM if 12-hour clock).
The time is optional. When not specified, it's defaulted to 00:00:00 (AM, midnight).

The date of the latest status change.
The preferred format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss (AM/PM). For example 2023-11-16 00:00:00 (and AM/PM if 12-hour clock).
The time is optional. When not specified, it's defaulted to 00:00:00 (AM, midnight).

# Description:

This endpoint returns prospects that have their status changed to the one specified in the filters over the specified date range.

If a status was eventually changed to itself (for example, Active -> Paused -> Finished -> Active), such a prospect wouldn't be in the result.

# Response data type:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| people | array | Ids of prospects |

request.description:
# Description:

Creates a new campaign in your Reply account. If the `Settings` section or the `EmailAccount` parameter is omitted from the request body, default settings or the default email account (if available) will be used re\\spectively

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Request Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description | Requirement |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `name` | string | Name of the campaign. | Required |
| `emailAccounts` | array | Email accounts that will be used to send emails for this campaign.. | Required |
| `EmailsCountPerDay` | integer | Maximum number of emails sent daily. | Required |
| `daysToFinishProspect` | integer | Days taken for a prospect to finish. | Required |
| `emailSendingDelaySeconds` | integer | Delay between sending emails (in seconds). | Required |
| `dailyThrottling` | integer | Number of prospects processed by the sequence within a 24-hour period. | Required |
| `disableOpensTracking` | boolean | Disables email open tracking. | Required |
| `repliesHandlingType` | string | How replies are handled (max length: 25). Options: "Mark person as finished", "Continue sending emails". | Required |
| `enableLinksTracking` | boolean | Enables link open tracking. | Required |
| `number` | integer | Step number. | Required |
| `inMinutesCount` | integer | For the first step: â‰¥ 0. For subsequent steps: > 1. | Required |
| `templates` | list | List of Campaign Step Template objects. | Required |

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `id` | string | Campaign ID. |
| `name` | string | Name of the campaign. |
| `emailAccounts` | array | One or more email accounts that will be used to send emails for this campaign. |
| `status` | string | Current campaign status. |
| `EmailsCountPerDay` | integer | Maximum number of emails sent daily. |
| `daysToFinishProspect` | integer | Days taken for a prospect to finish. |
| `daysFromLastProspectContact` | integer | Days since the last contact with the prospect. |
| `emailSendingDelaySeconds` | integer | Delay between sending emails (in seconds). |
| `disableOpensTracking` | boolean | Indicates if email open tracking is disabled. |
| `repliesHandlingType` | string | Defines how replies are handled. |
| `enableLinksTracking` | boolean | Indicates if link open tracking is enabled. |
| `number` | integer | Step number. |
| `inMinutesCount` | integer | Duration in minutes. |
| `templates` | list | List of Campaign Step Template objects. |

request.description:
# Description:

Creates a new campaign in your Reply account. If the `ScheduleID` parameter is omitted, the system will use the default user schedule for the campaign. For using a specific schedule, provide the `ScheduleID` in the request body.

# Note:

1. For Team Edition (Public/Private), you can use any schedule from team member accounts. However, default schedules are tied to a user account and differ among team members.
2. If an invalid `ScheduleID` is used in the Request Body, the system will return a `400` error code.
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Request Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description | Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| `name` | string | Name of the campaign. | Yes |
| `emailAccounts` | array | One or more email accounts that will be used to send emails for this campaign. | Yes |
| `ScheduleID` | integer | Schedule ID. Default user schedule is used if omitted. | No |
| `EmailsCountPerDay` | integer | Max number of emails sent daily. | Yes |
| `daysToFinishProspect` | integer | Number of days until the prospect is finished. | Yes |
| `emailSendingDelaySeconds` | integer | Seconds of delay between sending emails. | Yes |
| `dailyThrottling` | integer | Number of prospects processed within a 24-hour period. | Yes |
| `disableOpensTracking` | boolean | Flag to disable email open tracking. | Yes |
| `repliesHandlingType` | string | How replies are handled (max length: 25). Options: "Mark person as finished", "Continue sending emails". | Yes |
| `enableLinksTracking` | boolean | Flag to enable link open tracking. | Yes |
| `number` | integer | The step number. | Yes |
| `inMinutesCount` | integer | Time in minutes. >= '0' for the first step, > '1' for subsequent steps. | Yes |
| `templates` | list | List of Campaign Step Template objects. | Yes |

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `id` | string | Unique identifier for the campaign. |
| `name` | string | Name of the campaign. |
| `status` | string | Current campaign status. |
| `emailAccounts` | array | One or more email accounts that will be used to send emails for this campaign. |
| `ScheduleID` | integer | Schedule ID. |
| `EmailsCountPerDay` | integer | Max number of emails sent daily. |
| `daysToFinishProspect` | integer | Number of days until the prospect is finished. |
| `daysFromLastProspectContact` | integer | Number of days since the last contact with the prospect. |
| `emailSendingDelaySeconds` | integer | Seconds of delay between sending emails. |
| `disableOpensTracking` | boolean | Flag to disable email open tracking. |
| `repliesHandlingType` | string | How replies are handled. |
| `enableLinksTracking` | boolean | Flag to enable link open tracking. |
| `number` | integer | The step number. |
| `inMinutesCount` | integer | Time in minutes. |
| `templates` | list | List of Campaign Step Template objects. |

# Description:

Removes an existing step from an existing campaign.

# Notes:

- Cannot delete a step if the associated campaign was deleted or archived or if there is no campaign with the given ID.
- Cannot delete if there's only one step left in the campaign.
- Cannot delete if at least one email in the campaign
- Cannot delete step is an email was already sent from such step
    

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint

| --- | --- | --- |
| wasDeleted | boolean | Indicates whether an item was deleted |

# Description:

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| name | string | Campaign name. Required. |
| emailAccounts | array | One or more email accounts that will be used to send emails for this campaign. |
| settings | list | Settings for the campaign. |
| EmailsCountPerDay | integer | Maximum number of emails sent a day. Required. |
| daysToFinishProspect | integer | Number of days when the prospect finishes. Required. |
| emailSendingDelaySeconds | integer | Delay between sending emails in seconds. Required. |
| dailyThrottling | integer | Number of prospects processed by the sequence in a 24-hour period. Required. |
| disableOpensTracking | boolean | Disables email open tracking. Required. |
| repliesHandlingType | string | Defines how to handle replies. Required. |
| enableLinksTracking | boolean | Enables link open tracking. Required. |
| number | integer | Step number. Required. |
| inMinutesCount | integer | Must be >= '0' for the first step and > '1' for subsequent steps. Required. |

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | string | Step ID. |
| name | string | Campaign name. |
| emailAccounts | array | One or more email accounts that will be used to send emails for this campaign. |
| status | string | Campaign status. |
| number | integer | Step number. |
| settings | list | Settings for the campaign. |
| EmailsCountPerDay | integer | Maximum number of emails sent a day. |
| daysToFinishProspect | integer | Number of days when the prospect finishes. |
| daysFromLastProspectContact | integer | Days since the last email to a contact. |
| emailSendingDelaySeconds | integer | Delay between sending emails in seconds. |
| disableOpensTracking | boolean | Indicates if email open tracking is disabled. |
| repliesHandlingType | string | How replies are handled. |
| enableLinksTracking | boolean | Indicates if link open tracking is enabled. |
| steps | array | Contains all steps related to the campaign. Each step object includes `id`, `number`, `inMinutesCount`, `templates`. |

# Description:

Activates or pauses an email step variant in a sequence.

# Note:

The field `isDisabled` is slightly counter-intuitive based on its name. If `isDisabled` is `false`, it means the variant is enabled, and if `true`, it's disabled.

# Throttling:

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Request Body Data:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| activate | boolean | If `true`, activates the email step variant. If `false`, pauses the email step variant. |
| variantIds | array | List of step variant IDs. |

# Response Body Data:

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| stepId | integer | Campaign email step ID. |
| variantId | integer | Campaign step variant ID. |
| isDisabled | boolean | Indicates if the email step variant is enabled. |

# Description: Adds a new Branded Link to your Branded Link settings with the "Match the link with Sending domain' option # Notes - Added Link is always added with Reserved Status - Added Link is always added in deactivated State # Throttling: - There is no throttling for this endpoint # Request Body Data: | Field | Type | Description | Required | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `linkType` | string | The type of added link can be one of the following:

1 - Opt Outs Link

2- Opens
Link

3\. Click Track Link | Yes | | `CustomDomain` | string | Your personalized subdomain that is used to create branded links. | Yes | | `IsForMatchedEmailAccounts` | boolean | Sending Domain Option from the Branded Link Setup:

Set true: Creates a branded link with the "Matched sending domain" option enabled. This means the branded link will be configured to match and work specifically with the sending domain.

Set false: Creates a branded link without the "Matched sending domain" option. This means the branded link will not be restricted to a specific sending domain and can be used more broadly. | No | # Response Body Data: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `id` | integer | The ID of the added Branded Link | | `cnameHost` | string | This specifies the CNAME host. | | `txtHost` | string | This specifies the TXT host. | | `cnameValue` | string | This is the value that the CNAME record points to. | | `txtValue` | string | This is the value associated with the TXT record. |

1 - Opt Outs Link

2- Opens
Link

3\. Click Track Link | Yes | | `CustomDomain` | string | Your personalized subdomain that is used to create branded links. | Yes | | isForAllEmailAccounts | boolean | All Email Accounts Option from the Branded Link Setup:

Set true: Creates a branded link that is available for use by all email accounts. This means there are no restrictions, and any email account can utilize the branded link.

Set false: Creates a branded link that is restricted and not available for all email accounts. This means the branded link will only be usable by specific email accounts, based on certain criteria or configurations. | No | # Response Body Data: | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `id` | integer | The ID of the added Branded Link | | `cnameHost` | string | This specifies the CNAME host. | | `txtHost` | string | This specifies the TXT host. | | `cnameValue` | string | This is the value that the CNAME record points to. | | `txtValue` | string | This is the value associated with the TXT record. |

Activate or deactivate your added branded link by its ID.

- The activation and deactivation process may take some time to execute. The endpoint will not return any status code until the process has been completed, regardless of the outcome.

- There is no throttling for this endpoint
    

# Request Body Data:

- Set **true** in the request body to Activate the branded Link
    
- Set **false** in the request body to Deactivate the branded Link
